title: AWS re:Invent 2025 - Using AI to improve humanitarian workload resilience (AIM336)
title_cn: AWS re:Invent 2025 - 使用人工智能提高人道主义工作负载的韧性 (AIM336)
abstract: Almost everyone has experienced a bad IT day, when systems fail in unpredictable ways. For organizations operating in a humanitarian crisis, contextual continuity is mission critical. In this code talk, we'll explore how generative AI can help build more resilient humanitarian systems. Drawing from Werner Vogels' wisdom that "everything fails, all the time, so plan for failure and nothing will fail", we'll demonstrate practical techniques for identifying and mitigating potential system failures. Through live coding, attendees will learn to leverage AI to anticipate and address vulnerabilities, ensuring more robust and reliable humanitarian technology.
abstract_cn: 几乎每个人都经历过糟糕的IT日子，系统以不可预测的方式发生故障。对于在人道主义危机中运营的组织来说，上下文连续性至关重要。在本次代码讲座中，我们将探讨生成式AI如何帮助构建更具弹性的人道主义系统。借鉴Werner Vogels的智慧"一切都会失败，无时无刻，所以要为失败做好计划，这样就不会有任何失败"，我们将演示识别和缓解潜在系统故障的实用技术。通过现场编码，与会者将学习如何利用AI来预测和解决漏洞，确保更强大、更可靠的人道主义技术。
